timeline.message: RDM-10165: User names expected values changed
RDM-10165: Reverted to develop branch and use lombok

timeline.bodyText:
Why whole userToken?? we only need invoker's user details right?
it’s a bit odd to pass user auth token around systems rather than required userInfo elements.
timeline.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText:
hi @smathangi initial request from architects was to pass the whole token. I also thought userId would be enough so we started with userId.
The complication we found was that the IdamClient getUserDetails API wants the whole token in input to retrieve the user info, not the userId.
Therefore we moved back to the initial suggestion of passing the whole token.
I now also think that the benefit of passing the whole token is that the client can prove that he's authorised to use on_behalf_of because he has a valid token for that user
I'm not adamant on this though, I guess there are pros and cons for both approaches. What do you think?
replies.author: mario-paniccia

replies.bodyText:
CCD api is not using that token for authentication / authorisation purpose. So, to me what's the need to expose to CCD ?  Also one extra call to IDAM from ccd in the e2e user flow. Instead the caller (MCA) can actually pass all required bits (userid, first_name, lastName) in the payload.
I just thought of flagging this - either way is fine with me. (as architects already discussed )
replies.author: smathangi

replies.bodyText:
Just had a chat with Mario. For now we can keep the implementation as it is.
It can be improved a bit later once architects give it a thought on new proposals ( 1. Caller (mca) pass valid data for all required fields . Or 2. Caller pass userId and CCD uses it's own system-user-token to retrieve userInfo for a given userId).
replies.author: smathangi
